history.content:
To answer your questions:
1. For the next year, 8-hour GSIs will receive 29% fee remission, and 10+ hour GSIs will still receive 100%. This is for one year only while they figure out how to scale it. (Source: an email about the EECS-UAW agreement)

2. All GSIs are paid monthly at a fixed rate. The pay table lists rates for 40-hour appointments, so just divide accordingly depending on how many hours your appointment is, e.g. 8-hour GSIs would receive 20% of the listed pay rate.

3. Appointments are per semester, so fee remissions are per semester as well. Tuition is also paid per semester so there shouldn't be any fancy calculations. If you are an 8-hour GSI in the fall and then a 20-hour GSI in the spring, you would get 29% fee remission in the fall and 100% in the spring.

All of the above apply to both uGSIs and GSIs.

children.subject:
https://registrar.berkeley.edu/tuition-fees-residency/tuition-fees/fee-schedule

These are the approximate tuition fees for this school year (I expect it to increase a bit next year). I assume 5th year masters falls under "graduate: academic" since it lists a separate masters and PhD fee, but that might just be for the 2 year masters, unsure. My guess is that it will be ~$10k per semester for residents and ~$17.5k per sem for non-residents next year?
Does anyone what the tuition cost is for 5th years. I haven't been able to find a good source online.
Was wondering if the remissions apply to 5th year MIDS students as well?  Tuition for MIDS students is 60k/year.
Yup, before or after, but just get it in. (probably try to get it in before May 1)
Do we need to submit the petition before submitting an application?
Who are we supposed to send the petition to after filling it out?
What's the process like for applying for a tutor position?

history.content:
Hi all,

I believe that the question in the title is something many new admits to the program would like to know, so I took the liberty to conduct a small research about it. It should be stated that aside for the petition requirement, it seems like the process is not any different than application as a uGSI or regular GSI (requirements, such as GPA and class grade might differ).

The following are my conclusions using the following site: https://grad.berkeley.edu/financial/appointments/, and questions I was not able to answer are at the bottom.

If students / staff has answers to questions or corrections to this post, please respond / edit!

1. Application to be a GSI as a 5th year masters student starts at filing the following petition describing why does the student want to work as a GSI, and a research advisor signature confirming such an appointment will not harm the student's progress in his graduate studies.

Petition: https://berkeley.app.box.com/v/grad-general-petition

2. If the petition is accepted, the student should also apply using the official GSI application:

https://deptapps.eecs.berkeley.edu/ase/eecs/apply/f2020

3. As far as my understanding goes, the student should also approach the staff of the course they want to instruct, and submit another application with them (usually applications are posted on the courses' piazza around this time of the semester).

4. If you are accepted as a GSI and this will be your first time as an instructor, the following steps should also be completed (international students' applications might slightly differ):

(i)  Attend the teaching conference for first-time GSIs on August 20th, 2020.

(ii) Complete an online ethics course.

(iii) Previously completed or concurrently enrolled into 300-level CS class (I assume CS370 or CS375).

(iv) Attend a new AES (Academic Student Employee) orientation.

(v) Have a full-time student standing for the semester requested.


Questions:
1. From the 5th yr MS website: "EECS 5th Year Bachelor/Masters (5th Yr MS) Program students may serve as GSIs during the graduate program, with the usual fee remission applied to UGGSI".

The terms for fee remissions could be found here: https://grad.berkeley.edu/financial/appointments/handbook/#requirementsftgsi

Following the UAW grievance, 8-hour GSIs will be entitled to 25% fee remission?

20-hour GSIs are entitled for a 50% fee remission?

2. Are we entitled to the fixed monthly pay rates as GSIs (listed here: https://hr.berkeley.edu/labor/contracts/BX/current-rates), or is there another pay table? Do they differ between 8-hour and 20-hour GSI positions?

Edit: I'm speculating it might be the salary for a 40-hour position, hence if it is the case - will it simply be divided by the fractional portion of the actual GSI position?

3. Are the fee remissions offered per semester of instructing? Hence two semesters of a 25% GSI position are equal to 50% fee remission? Or only two full semesters of 25% GSI position grant the student with 25% fee remission? If that is the case - what happens if a course is only offered in one semester?

Hope this helps, and hope to get the questions answered to clear these things before we send our applications!
